basics.name: Eric Kim
basics.label: Full-stack Developer / Consultant
basics.summary: Strongly focused in web technologies and third-party API integrations. Interested in UI design and DevOps automation. Coding since 2004. Professionally since 2010.

work.summary: Technologies: Java (Spring), React, AngularJS, Docker, AWS
highlights: Co-founded a consulting firm - event-driven microservices and continuous delivery
Developing tool to assist in creation of event-driven tasks. Uses user-friendly third-party API integration and data manipulation to simplify the creation of microservices

work.summary: Technologies: Java (Spring), AngularJS, Docker, Maestro, ELK
highlights: Assigned to work in self-managed team - tasked with creating a product to unify new and legacy services, refactoring + merging MySQL and legacy MSSQL schemas, and creating a secure REST API for public usage
Designed and developed AngularJS-based ad-management solution - reduced page load speeds by 10x, decoupled Java API, analyzed and simplified workflow
Identified need for standalone authentication service - implemented with OAuth 2.0 support
Developed secure REST API integrated with new authentication service
Advocated and initiated company-wide Slack adoption in an effort to reduce email clutter - integrated Jenkins, Atlassian products, and logging to assist self-management for all teams

work.summary: Technologies: Java (Spring, Hibernate, Maven, JUnit), Force.com (APEX, VisualForce), JMS, Jenkins, MariaDB, Docker
highlights: Appointed lead developer for Salesforce integration project - architected secure, fail-safe integration with Salesforce and internal Java-based API to automate sales process and ad campaign creation
Completely rebuilt Force.com platform to allow highly customized views and logic
Worked on team responsible for creating Eyereturn's first client facing ad-management solution
Refactored monolith into microservices running on docker containers, reducing potential impact and involvement of various teams for releases
Integrated third-party API's for cross-platform consumption

work.summary: Technologies: Java (Spring), NodeJS, JavaScript, AngularJS, Thrift, AWS
highlights: Created specifications + documentation and managed initial phase for Salesforce integration project

Implemented Apache Thrift into existing tightly-coupled monolith application to support cross-language communication. Developed integration with legacy ad-trafficking and accounting software. Implementation was also used for tracking and reporting
Developed email system using NodeJS, Express, and AngularJS to automate user interaction
Initiated and developed re-usable geo-targeting support for ads
Integrated client website analytics for ad-retargeting and conversion reporting
Developed multiple HTML5/JavaScript advertisements

work.summary: Technologies: PHP, Ruby, AngularJS, jQuery, MongoDB, Redis
highlights: Existing vendor solutions for digital signage had 50% uptime. Initiated, designed, and developed web-based digital signage. Result: 99% uptime, no more blackbox (extendable), no recurring vendor cost
Designed and developed web application to manage, transform, and merge multiple RSS & Twitter feed sources
Created REST API for aggregated feeds - to be consumed by signage, dashboards, and OHLS website
Developed application to consume feeds and post to WordPress blog
Worked with SysAdmins to develop dashboards for server monitoring
Optimized employee productivity by developing chrome extension to assist employees in performing tasks on York Central IT legacy websites

work.summary: Technologies: PHP, Ruby, jQuery, HTML5, CSS3 & LESS, MySQL, WordPress, AWS
highlights: Founded digital agency while in university. Employed fellow students, creating opportunities for student jobs and practical experience
Created web application to assist in student enrolment, hosted on EC2 and RDS
Formed partnership with Blipp Global to develop client websites
Designed, developed, and maintained multiple WordPress websites and plugins with custom theming
